main event: An observer sighted a star-like object in the eastern sky that almost instantly disappeared on 30 November 1967.
interesting points: The object was first seen in the east and then moved across the sky., The observer thought the object was Saturn due to its brightness., The object was described as bluish-white in color and moved rapidly in an erratic manner., It remained in view for about 10-15 seconds before disappearing., Others reported seeing a similar object in the eastern sky around the same time.
witness description: The observers were stargazing when they noticed the object.
